R: @bjchambers
Fixed Dan's review comments.

Hi Romain,
Welcome to Beam! I'm glad to see your contribution!

On a high level -- we really need to work well on Windows. Thanks for starting this effort. In fact, we need to add integration testing on Windows as soon as possible.

Code-wise, we need to find a different solution -- we cannot really download random, untrusted files and execute them on users' machine.

Again, thanks and welcome!
There are build breaks.
Actually, I was wrong before -- GitHub will automatically close PRs going into the default branch only, not into feature branches. So, you'd have to click the close button yourself for a little bit.
Closing then. Thanks for pushing.

Hi Davor,

Updated the comments. Let me know if it is better or worse ;).

Changed a bit the downloading to add a sanity check (we could replace it by a checksum but the best would be to be able to use gpg --verify but seems bouncycastle doesn't fully match gpg format).

This repo is not really random since it is provided by an asf committer and I downgraded to a signed binary version. A maybe better alternative is to package a beam-hadoop-win jar with this exe and just explode it if running tests on windows - drawback is we put a binary in a jar, advantage is beam owns this binary.

wdyt?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5882905/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5882905)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
@dhalperi It should be OK now.
@kennknowles All passing now.
R: @davorbonaci or @dhalperi

Already caught a suspicious dependency:

```
runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/util/GroupAlsoByWindowViaWindowSetDoFn.java:[33,40] package org.apache.beam.runners.core does not exist
```
Believe that file can be removed now.

This is definitely safer, but I feel we are still exposing a potentially unnecessary attack surface to our users.

Would you be able to summarize the problem on the Windows platform, and how does this binary solves it?
I think putting it back in the old namespace is simplest.
Once the fragility of the service to this namespacing is fixed, we can just do the move along with all the rest of runners-core.
False: it is the new name that must remain. I've put it back.

Sure, on windows hadoop relies for most commands (including chmods which are the first commands triggered in beam) on winutils.exe to actually execute the action (https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/util/Shell.java#L224 for instance). It does find the winutils.exe from hadoop home which is ATM not set in beam. If you have locally hadoop with winutils.exe - not provided by ASF yet - and set the home properly then most of tests - excepted the one using Path but that's something else - should be fine but if you don't you need that workaround cause Shell of hadoop get winutils in a static block (https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/util/Shell.java#L639) and it can be null. If null it will not remove the option but execute commands with a null entry in the array (processbuilder.execute([null, "chmod", ....])) which leads to a NPE.

Side note: if you are curious chmod is implemented like that https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/winutils/chmod.c with win API

We can also propose to hadoop a degraded mode where if winutils is not there and a "test" flag activated we try to do these operations in java and if it fails we ignore them when acceptable (chmod/chown should be ok to ignore for tests for instance). Didn't check if it would be doable for all winutils operations.
R: @bjchambers

LGTM on the current version (runtime scope + removal of `org.apache.beam.sdk.util.GroupAlsoByWindowViaWindowSetDoFn`).

Please squash / self-merge, once test pass. Manual streaming test would be good too.
The history of this branch seems to be heavily polluted -- you may have been merging? I suspect you need to rebase on top of master so that only your commits show up.

To be specific, since a few branches are in play:

``` bash
git checkout pttest
git rebase apache/python-sdk
```

You can get fancier, but I don't think you need to.
I will close this and send a new PR with a clean history. Thank you.
LGTM

I think the alternative could be a better approach overall. In general, `chmod` is rarely needed on Windows and with minimal benefits in the testing environment.

There are others too -- tools like Cygwin, etc. provide many of these utilities. Finally, Microsoft announced [Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)](https://blogs.windows.com/buildingapps/2016/03/30/run-bash-on-ubuntu-on-windows/) that enables the scenario too.

So, I think we could try with a degraded mode first. What do you think?

Separately, I have to kindly ask not to [push commits](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/b74fd53d19088cf37561f411c6bd2f41e6c3e9db076d69dfb280640c@%3Ccommits.beam.apache.org%3E) to our repository, including creating a [feature branch](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/853a948e571c36c1e819ab704918340a091fcc664f73c4fab61b0063@%3Ccommits.beam.apache.org%3E).
(It is generally easier to rewrite history of your PR branch. That way, we use the same PR and keep the history of comments, review, etc. This is fine too, but generally less preferable.)

Yep, cygwin could be detected and surely enough.

Will try to find some time for it and finally change this PR for a hadoop upgrade + the few other fixes.

About the push: mea culpa, bad ctrl+R, deleted it just after.

Checkstyle :-(

Changes LGTM. Commit message should be of the form `<subject>\n\n<body>`. Perhaps something like:

```
Throw NondeterministicException in AvroCoder when type lost to erasure

Previously, the loss of the type information resulted in an IllegalArgumentException
that left a user no recourse. Now, the coder can be used but it will
not be a deterministic coder.
```

But since you are the author, perhaps you can write what you feel is appropriate prior to self-merge.

Even though this is pretty trivial, still send Flink-runner related PRs to the folks who manage it, @mxm and @aljoscha.

Even for this PR, this `toString()` is copied from the `DataflowRunner`, and maybe they want to do something entirely different.
Merging on @silviulica 's LGTM
Merged to python-sdk branch. Please close PR manually as GitHub won't close it until the "closes PR" commit makes it into master branch.

Just a heads up: you are going to need to add a dependency on `runners/core-java` as we are in the process of moving utilities there.

```
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.apache.beam</groupId>
  <artifactId>beam-runners-core-java</artifactId>
</dependency>
```

All fixed up. Please take another look.
